required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ClinicCompanion. Compared to the Use of a Goniometer
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Effectiveness of clinicCompanion. Compared to the Use of a Goniometer for Range of Motion Measurement.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Aurora Research Integrity Committee

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the goal is to find out if the clinicCompanion™ is effective in measuring range of motion when compared to the goniometer. Currently, the goniometer is an approved device to measure range of motion by the FDA, but the clinicCompanion™ is not.

detailed_description.textblock: The study procedure will test the range of motion of the subjects shoulders two different ways: using a goniometer and using the clinicCompanion™. Both tools are designed to measure the degree of movement subjects are able to do. Researchers will take 12 measurements on each arm for each device, for a total of 24 measurements per device. That is a total of 48 measurements for both devices.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Control cost and enhance accuracy of measurerment
primary_outcome.time_frame: The goal is to recruit 50 subjects in 12 months
primary_outcome.description: By freeing the doctor from data collection, he or she will be able to spend more time with patient discussing medical conditions and providing pertinent information

clinical_study.condition: Test the Capability of the clinicCompanion™ to Receive a Series of Joint Motions, Convert These Motions Into Range of Motion (ROM) Data.

study_pop.textblock: New or established clinic patients from Aurora St. Luke's Medical Center. The subjects will be recruited from the principal investigator's medical practice. Any patient may be included in the study, regardless of his/her diagnosis and must be 18 years of age and older.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
New or established clinic patients from Aurora St. Luke's Medical Center. The subjects will be recruited from the principal investigator's medical practice. No patients from outside physician practices will be recruited. Subjects will be recruited from Aurora St. Luke's Medical Center. Any patient may be included in the study, regardless of his/her diagnosis and must be 18 years of age and older.
-
Exclusion Criteria:
The only patients excluded from this study are those who have no use of limbs or amputees.
